snippet: The two countries exchanged sharp views at a session in Hanoi to discuss a Chinese oil rig deployed in contested waters in the South China Sea.
abstract: China and Vietnam exchange sharp views in their dispute over a Chinese oil rig deployed in contested waters in the South China Sea near Vietnam’s coast; China accuses Vietnam of interfering in operations and warns it will takes measures to ensure rig's safety; Vietnam says China has violated its sovereignty and breached regional and international agreements.

byline.contributor: Mike Ives contributed reporting from Hanoi, Vietnam.

lead_paragraph: The two countries exchanged sharp views at a session in Hanoi to discuss a Chinese oil rig deployed in contested waters in the South China Sea.

headline.main: For Vietnam and China, No Easing of Tensions
headline.print_headline: No Easing of Tensions Over China Oil Rig
